intro: Haworthia erecta, commonly known as the upright Haworthia, is a compact, evergreen succulent native to South Africa. It features a rosette of thick, fleshy, blue-green leaves that are often adorned with white or pale markings. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange during the warmer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright, indirect light. Due to its slow growth and unique appearance, it is a popular choice for indoor gardening and rock gardens.
